references.B90ZEI02USGP: Zeiner, D. C., et al., editors. 1990. California's wildlife. Vol. II. Mammals. California Dept. Fish & Game, Sacramento. xi + 407 pp.

habitat_description:
Southwest:
This California endemic heteromyid mouse occurs from San Francisco south to the Mexican border and east to the Sierra Nevada foothills. The species inhabits coastal scrub, montane chapparal, sagebrush, annual grasslands, valley foothill hardwoods and hardwood-confier mixed forest up to 2400 m in elevation. It feeds on seeds of annual grasses and forbs on the edge of grass and chapparal habitats. Burrows and excavated suitable soils throuhgout slopes of shrubland/chapparal growth (Brylski et al. based on Zeiner et al. 1990, NatureServe 2004).
